section_path: Section I > B. General Coding Guidelines > 11. Impending or Threatened Condition

content.full_text: Code any condition described at the time of discharge as "impending" or "threatened" as follows: If it did occur, code as confirmed diagnosis. If it did not occur, reference the Alphabetic Index to determine if the condition has a subentry term for "impending" or "threatened" and also reference main term entries for "Impending" and for "Threatened." If the subterms are listed, assign the given code. If the subterms are not listed, code the existing underlying condition(s) and not the condition described as impending or threatened. (Evidence: pg no: 15, L72-L75)
content.summary: Provides specific coding instructions for conditions described as impending or threatened, with different approaches based on whether the condition occurred and whether specific index entries exist. (Evidence: pg no: 15, L72-L75)
key_concepts: Different coding based on whether condition occurred (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74)
If occurred, code as confirmed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74)
If not occurred, check Alphabetic Index for specific subterms (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74-L75)
Check both condition subterms and main term entries (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74-L75)
If no subterms exist, code underlying conditions only (Evidence: pg no: 15, L75)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If impending/threatened condition occurred, code as confirmed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a condition that was described as impending or threatened actually occurred during the encounter, it should be coded as a confirmed diagnosis rather than as impending or threatened (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74)
common_applications: Threatened abortion that progressed to actual abortion

detailed_rules.rule_text: If condition did not occur, check for specific 'impending' or 'threatened' subterms (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74-L75)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the impending or threatened condition did not actually occur, check the Alphabetic Index for specific subentry terms under the condition and also check main term entries for 'Impending' and 'Threatened' (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74-L75)
common_applications: Threatened abortion that did not progress
Impending myocardial infarction that was prevented

detailed_rules.rule_text: If specific subterms exist, assign the given code (Evidence: pg no: 15, L75)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the Alphabetic Index contains specific subentry terms for 'impending' or 'threatened' under the condition, or when main term entries exist for 'Impending' or 'Threatened', assign the code provided by these entries (Evidence: pg no: 15, L75)
common_applications: Using specific impending condition codes when available
Following index guidance for threatened conditions

detailed_rules.rule_text: If no subterms listed, code underlying conditions only (Evidence: pg no: 15, L75)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the Alphabetic Index does not contain specific subentry terms for 'impending' or 'threatened', code only the existing underlying condition(s) and do not code the condition described as impending or threatened (Evidence: pg no: 15, L75)
common_applications: Coding underlying heart disease for impending MI without specific code
Coding underlying conditions when no threatened subterm exists
Avoiding unspecified codes for impending conditions

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify condition described as impending or threatened
Step 2: Determine if the condition actually occurred during encounter
Step 3: If occurred, code as confirmed diagnosis
Step 4: If not occurred, check Alphabetic Index for condition subterms
Step 5: Also check main term entries for 'Impending' and 'Threatened'
Step 6: If subterms exist, assign the given code
Step 7: If no subterms, code only underlying conditions

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with threatened abortion that did not progress
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Admission diagnosis: Threatened abortion at 12 weeks gestation. Patient stabilized, bleeding stopped, pregnancy continuing normally.
step_by_step: Step 2: Determine abortion did not occur
Step 3: Check Alphabetic Index for 'threatened' under abortion
Step 4: Find specific code for threatened abortion
Step 5: Assign the threatened abortion code

correct_coding.rationale: Specific code exists for threatened abortion in index (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74-L75)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not code actual abortion when it was only threatened and did not occur
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding the actual condition when it was only threatened

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with impending respiratory failure that actually occurred
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Admission: Impending respiratory failure. During stay, patient developed acute respiratory failure requiring intubation.
step_by_step: Step 2: Determine respiratory failure actually occurred
Step 4: Assign acute respiratory failure code

correct_coding.rationale: Condition occurred, so code as confirmed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should code actual condition when it occurred, not impending
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding impending when actual condition occurred

warnings: Always check if impending/threatened condition actually occurred (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74)
Do not code impending condition if no specific subterms exist (Evidence: pg no: 15, L75)
best_practices: Check both condition subterms and main term entries for Impending/Threatened (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74-L75)
Code underlying conditions when no specific impending/threatened codes exist (Evidence: pg no: 15, L75)
common_mistakes: Coding actual condition when it was only threatened (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74)
Missing specific threatened/impending subterms in index (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74-L75)
tips: Look carefully at discharge documentation to determine if condition occurred (Evidence: pg no: 15, L72-L74)
Check main term entries for 'Impending' and 'Threatened' (Evidence: pg no: 15, L74-L75)
implementation_notes: Requires careful review of clinical course during encounter
clinical_context: Common in obstetrics for threatened conditions
Important in emergency and critical care settings
